subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja|箏}} {{wp|Koto (musical instrument)}} [[File:Japanese_Koto.jpg|thumb|250px|{{m|ja|琴|tr=koto}}: a Japanese ''koto'', a kind of [[zither]].]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|こと}} {{IPAfont|⟨ko2to2⟩}} → *{{IPAchar|/kətə/}} → {{IPAchar|/koto/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=こと|-}}, attested in the three major literature works of the {{w|Nara period}}: the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' (712 {{CE}}), the ''{{w|Nihon Shoki}}'' (720 {{CE}}), and the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' (''c.'' 759 {{CE}}).{{RQ:Manyoshu|18|1435}}, text [http://jti.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man18Yo.html#4135 here] Possibly derived from a compound of elements {{compound|ja|木|tr1=ko|t1=[[tree]], [[wood]]|pos1=combining form|音|tr2=oto|t2=[[sound]]|nocat=1}}, with the additional medial ''o'' dropped by [[haplology]].

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja|琴}} {{wp|Guqin}}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kanon|きん}} {{IPAchar|/kim/}} → {{IPAchar|/kimʉ/}} → {{IPAchar|/kiɴ/}} From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=きん|-}} {{ltc-l|琴}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] pronunciation, so likely a later borrowing.

subSections.title: Derived terms
See also
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|箏|そう|[[guzheng]], [[zheng]]}}: a Chinese [[zither]] similar to the Japanese ''koto''
* {{ja-r|瑟|しつ|[[se]]}}: another kind of ancient Chinese [[zither]]
